intro: Inga stevensonii, commonly known as Stevenson's inga, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Inga stevensonii plays an important ecological role in supporting biodiversity and soil health in its native habitat.
